message.content:
We need to determine the “Sales Expenses” (or “Selling Expenses”) line from the income‐statement. In this exercise we extract the transactions with a type equal to “Sales Expenses” and then add up their “amount” values. (Note: Other expense types such as “Administrative Expenses” and “Financial Expenses” are not included.)

Step‐by‐step we scan the list and pick those rows whose type is “Sales Expenses.” (Below each bullet shows the row and its “amount” value.)

1. Expense20240103001 | Sales Expenses | amount = 73,422.33  
2. Expense20240104001 | Sales Expenses | amount = 57,286.12  
3. Expense20240107001 | Sales Expenses | amount = 50,312.93  
4. Expense20240107001 | Sales Expenses | amount = 18,529.12

19. Expense20240123001 | Sales Expenses | amount = 29,336.31

22. Expense20240126001 | Sales Expenses | amount = 79,494.60  
23. Expense20240127001 | Sales Expenses | amount = 70,681.23  
24. Expense20240129001 | Sales Expenses | amount = 14,158.49  
25. Expense20240129001 | Sales Expenses | amount = 72,125.70  
26. Expense20240130001 | Sales Expenses | amount = 68,047.29  
27. Expense20240131001 | Sales Expenses | amount = 26,885.73  
28. Expense20240203001 | Sales Expenses | amount = 90,337.66  
29. Expense20240203001 | Sales Expenses | amount = 32,201.46  

Now we add up these amounts (all figures are in currency‐units):

• After 4 rows: 73,422.33 + 57,286.12 + 50,312.93 + 18,529.12 = 199,550.50  
• Adding rows 5–7: 23,835.49 + 10,656.44 + 79,175.30 = 113,667.23; cumulative = 199,550.50 + 113,667.23 = 313,217.73  
• Rows 8–9: 83,043.95 + 30,521.87 = 113,565.82; cumulative = 313,217.73 + 113,565.82 = 426,783.55  
• Row 10: +94,406.29 = 521,189.84  
• Row 11: +42,974.21 = 564,164.05  
• Row 12: +81,067.73 = 645,231.78  
• Row 13: +25,941.18 = 671,172.96  
• Row 14: +21,329.49 = 692,502.45  
• Row 15: +85,787.82 = 778,290.27  
• Row 16: +78,068.15 = 856,358.42  
• Row 17: +11,973.24 = 868,331.66  
• Row 18: +79,415.78 = 947,747.44  
• Row 19: +29,336.31 = 977,083.75  
• Row 20: +20,565.70 = 997,649.45  
• Row 21: +16,489.93 = 1,014,139.38  
• Row 22: +79,494.60 = 1,093,633.98  
• Row 23: +70,681.23 = 1,164,315.21  
• Row 24: +14,158.49 = 1,178,473.70  
• Row 25: +72,125.70 = 1,250,599.40  
• Row 26: +68,047.29 = 1,318,646.69  
• Row 27: +26,885.73 = 1,345,532.42  
• Row 28: +90,337.66 = 1,435,870.08  
• Row 29: +32,201.46 = 1,467,071.54  

Thus the total “Sales Expenses” (or “Selling Expenses”) is 1,467,071.54.

The final answer in the required JSON format is:

--------------------------------------------------

{

}
